hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bull Regime Transition via 20D Volatility Compression Breakout
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime (confidence >60%) with 20-day realized volatility compressing below 40% annualized, a breakout above the 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std) on >1.5x average volume signals an imminent transition to BULL regime, with mean reversion to the 50-day SMA providing optimal entry.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Volatility compression in neutral regimes often precedes directional moves. Breakouts with volume confirmation signal institutional accumulation. Pullback to 50-day SMA provides better risk/reward. MiCA/UK regulatory clarity reduces uncertainty, potentially triggering new capital inflows.
entry_conditions: BTC price closes above 20-day Bollinger Band upper band (2 std)
Volume on breakout day > 1.5x 20-day average volume
Wait for pullback to 50-day SMA for entry

exit_conditions.take_profit: 15% gain from entry OR regime shifts to BULL (confidence >70%) and holds for 3 days
exit_conditions.stop_loss: 8% below entry price OR regime reverts to NEUTRAL/BEAR

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 40% of such breakouts fail to sustain BULL regime transition within 14 days OR result in immediate mean reversion below breakout level.
